Unnamed: 1: 3-3 Management of material topics
Unnamed: 2: 2023 Sustainability Report p.6-7

Unnamed: 1: 404-1 Average hours of training per year per employee
Unnamed: 5: We are improving our training data collection by gender and employee category. Limited data is available in our 2023 Sustainability Report.

Unnamed: 1: 404-2 Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
Unnamed: 2: Coles provides a range of programs at all levels of the organisation to upskill team members and support career progression - this is covered in our Sustainability report under Great Place to Work p. 37. Coles is also committed to supporting team members who are transitioning from our business due to retirement, redundancy or termination. This can include reskilling programs through TAFE, learning resources, outplacement and employee assistance programs.\n

Unnamed: 1: 404-3 Percentage of employees receiving regular performance and career development reviews
Unnamed: 2: All Coles salaried team members and store leaders have formal performance reviews annually and we encourage continuous conversations all year round that includes receiving regular feedback on performance and development progress. Our performance management process is captured in real time using an online system.

Unnamed: 1: 405-2 Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
Unnamed: 5: Coles is working to align its public reporting to GRI requirements in future years. As disclosed in our 2023 Sustainability Report, in FY23, our gender pay parity gap is -0.9%.

Unnamed: 1: 3-3 Management of material topics
Unnamed: 2: 2023 Sustainability Report p.6-7

Unnamed: 1: 406-1 Incidents of discrimination and corrective actions taken
Unnamed: 2: We received a small number allegations of discrimination by customers against Coles team members. No allegations were substantiated. \nWe also received a small number of allegations of discrimination by team members against other team members and a number of these resulted in disciplinary action.
